briefdescription.para: 7bit IIC address mask
10bit IIC address mask
Define IIC control commands for common usage.
Define IIC control commands for master usage.
Define IIC control commands for slave usage.
Get current device status.

listitem.para: Param usage : store result of current status

briefdescription.para: Set iic addressing mode.

listitem.para: Param usage : iic addressing mode, possible values can be found here

briefdescription.para: Set iic transmit success callback function when all required bytes are transmitted for interrupt method.

listitem.para: Param usage : transmit success callback function for iic

briefdescription.para: Set iic receive success callback function when all required bytes are received for interrupt method.

listitem.para: Param usage : receive success callback function for iic

briefdescription.para: Set iic transfer error callback function when something error happened for interrupt method.

listitem.para: Param usage : transfer error callback function for iic

briefdescription.para: Set buffer for interrupt transmit, and it will set tx_buf.

listitem.para: IIC master mode use case For master mode, if you set tx buffer to NULL, when tx interrupt is enabled and entered into tx interrupt, it will automatically disable the tx interrupt, so when you want to transfer something, you need to set the tx buffer to Non-NULL and enable tx interrupt, when the tx buffer is sent, it will disable the tx interrupt and call tx callback function if available.

IIC slave mode use case For slave mode, the tx buffer is not used, only tx callback function is used, and if tx callback is not set, then it will automatically disable the tx interrupt, if tx callback is set, it will call the tx callback function and you need to write or read in the tx callback function, to avoid meaningless waiting, you can use control command IIC_CMD_GET_TXAVAIL to get how many bytes space existing in transmit fifo, and use iic_write to send the available bytes.
Param usage : buffer structure pointer, if param is NULL, then it will set tx_buf to NULL

briefdescription.para: Set buffer for interrupt receive, and it will set rx_buf.

listitem.para: IIC master mode use case Similar to IIC_CMD_SET_TXINT_BUF
IIC slave mode use case Similiar to IIC_CMD_SET_TXINT_BUF
Param usage : buffer structure pointer, if param is NULL, then it will set rx_buf to NULL

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable transmit interrupt, for master mode, only one of tx and rx interrupt can be enabled, if tx interrupt is enabled, then rx interrupt can't be changed.

listitem.para: Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable receive interrupt, for master mode, only one of tx and rx interrupt can be enabled, if rx interrupt is enabled, then tx interrupt can't be changed.

listitem.para: Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag

briefdescription.para: Abort current interrupt transmit operation if tx interrupt enabled, it will disable transmit interrupt, and set DEV_IN_TX_ABRT in status variable, and call the transmit callback function, when tx callback is finished, it will clear DEV_IN_TX_ABRT and return.

Abort current interrupt receive operation if rx interrupt enabled, it will disable receive interrupt, and set DEV_IN_TX_ABRT in status variable, and call the receive callback function, when rx callback is finished, it will clear DEV_IN_TX_ABRT and return.
Do a software reset for IIC device, it will stop current transfer, and clear error state and bring device to normal state, set next condition to STOP.
Flush iic device transmit buffer or fifo.
Flush iic device receive buffer or fifo.
Enable iic device.

listitem.para: Param usage : param is not required

briefdescription.para: Disable iic device, when device is disabled, only IIC_CMD_ENA_DEV, IIC_CMD_DIS_DEV, IIC_CMD_GET_STATUS and IIC_CMD_RESET commands can be executed, other commands will return E_SYS.

listitem.para: Param usage : param is not required

briefdescription.para: Get how many bytes space in iic are available to transmit, this can be used in interrupt callback functions, cooperate with iic_write API to realize non-blocked write.

listitem.para: Param usage : store the write available bytes, > 0 for available bytes, 0 for not available

briefdescription.para: Get how many bytes in iic are available to receive, this can be used in interrupt callback functions, cooperate with iic_read API to realize non-blocked read.

listitem.para: Param usage : store the read available bytes, > 0 for available bytes, 0 for not available

briefdescription.para: Set iic speed mode.

listitem.para: Param usage : iic speed mode, possible values can be found here, and if passing mode is not supported, it will choose a lower supported speed mode

briefdescription.para: Set next condition for following transmit or receive operation.

detaileddescription.para:
For example, you can change next condition before iic_read or iic_write, then in iic_read/iic_write operation, it will send a STOP/RESTART condition after the last byte of this operation. For interrupt, this is similar.
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : next condition can be IIC_NEXT_CONDTION
Return value explanation :

briefdescription.para: Set target slave device address for selecting slave device.

listitem.para: Param usage : target slave address value

briefdescription.para: Set slave address when working as slave iic device.
Get slave state when working as slave iic device.
Set extra information pointer of iic info.
Get extra information pointer of iic info.

detaileddescription.para: Bidirectional, Standard-mode (Sm), with a bit rate up to 100 kbit/s
Bidirectional, Fast-mode (Fm), with a bit rate up to 400 kbit/s
Bidirectional, Fast-mode Plus (Fm+), with a bit rate up to 1 Mbit/s
Bidirectional, High-speed mode (Hs-mode), with a bit rate up to 3.4 Mbit/s
Unidirectional(Write only), Ultra Fast-mode (UFm), with a bit rate up to 5 Mbit/s

briefdescription.para: IIC Bus possible speed modes.

detaileddescription.para: Send a STOP condition after write/read operation
Send a RESTART condition after write/read operation

briefdescription.para: IIC next Condition.

detaileddescription.para: Currently in iic device free state
Master or slave lost bus during operation
Slave address is sent but not addressed by any slave devices
Data in transfer is not acked when it should be acked
Transfer timeout, no more data is received or sent
Slave received a STOP condition from master device
Undefined error cases

briefdescription.para: IIC Error State.

detaileddescription.para: Currently in iic device free state
Currently in iic master transmit state
Currently in iic master receive state

briefdescription.para: IIC Working State.

detaileddescription.para: Use 7bit address mode
Use 10bit address mode

briefdescription.para: IIC Addressing Mode.

detaileddescription.para: None state, in free
Start or Restart condition, clear it when read
Stop condition, clear it when read
Read request from master, this will trigger the slave transmit callback
Read request done from master, clear it when read
Write request from master, this will trigger the slave receive callback
General call request from master
Error, clear it when read

briefdescription.para: IIC Slave State.
IIC Bus possible speed modes.
IIC next Condition.
IIC Error State.
IIC Working State.
IIC Addressing Mode.
IIC Slave State.
iic information struct definition

detaileddescription.para: informations about iic open state, working state, baurate, iic registers, working method, interrupt number

briefdescription.para: iic device interface definition

detaileddescription.para:
define iic device interface, like iic information structure, fuctions to get iic info, open/close/control iic, send/receive data by iic
all this details are implemented by user in user porting code

briefdescription.para: get an iic device by iic device id.

detaileddescription.para:
For how to use iic device hal refer to Functions in iic device structure
iic_id
id of iic, defined by user
!NULL
pointer to an iic device structure
NULL
failed to find the iic device by iic_id
need to implemented by user in user code get an iic device by iic device id.

briefdescription.para: iic device hardware layer definitions

detaileddescription.para: provide common definitions for iic device, then software developer can develop iic driver following this definitions, and the applications can directly call this definition to realize functions
